Title: update Xerces in the Ant runtime classpath
description: When the user sets to launch Ant in a separate VM, we need to notify them to change the classpath (or do it automatically on confirmation from the user). The classpath needs the addition of the Xerces JARs and the appropriate tools.jar (bug 38267).

Title: Make enabling and disabling expressions part of the debug framework.
description:
It would be nice if enabling and disabling of expressions worked like it does 
for breakpoints.  Currently we have an enable button in our expression dialog 
like JDT does.  However, we ran some user sessions and discovered that people 
found this very confusing, they expected to be able to right click on the 
expression and enable or disable it rather than having to bring up an "edit 
expression" dialog.

If there were a canDisable() method on an expression then the menu items could 
show up only where appropriate (e.g. some Java expressions are only evaluated 
once and therefore it does not make sense to disable them).

Title: Infinite loop in exception loging
description: See bug 39167. If a log listener is ill behaved, it can cause an infinite loop in the logging (i.e. logging throws and exception, which is logged, which throsw an exception, etc). John A has seen the stacktrace and is aware of the problem.

Title: Use a Job for the BackgroundResourceRefresher
description:
When resources are refreshed for a external tool that is run in the background 
no reporting occurs. If the refreshing occurred as a Job, the user will be able 
in the future to see what is occurring.

Title: New Updates doesn't reload feature

Title: [Live Sync View] Nested events cause event loss
description:
It the processing of a team change event causes team change events to be 
generated, the SyncSet will reset its previously processed changes. This will 
cause the sync viewer to display improper state for some resources. The only 
known cause is deletion conflicts.

The best solution is to queue incoming events (both team and resource deltas) 
and have a job that processes them. The class where the queue should be used 
is SyncSetInputFromSubscriber.

Once this is completed, the method testDeletionConflicts() should be removed 
from the class SyncViewTests so that it will no longer obscure the real test 
in the superclass.

description: 3.0 M2 I've come accross another issue with our refactoring of the Synchronize view away from the DiffTreeViewer. Title: Incorrect worker pool logic causing too many thread creations
description:
Build: I20030826

The job worker pool has the following logic to decide if a new thread needs to
be created:

if ((busyThreads >= threadCount && threadCount < MAX_THREADS) || (job != null &&
job.getPriority() == Job.INTERACTIVE))

This intends to read: "start a new thread if all threads are busy and we are
still below the max thread count, OR, if the job is INTERACTIVE and hence must
be run no matter what.

However, the brackets are wrong.  The crucial bug is that it starts a new thread
if the job is INTERACTIVE even if there are threads that are not busy.  This is
causing hundreds of threads to be created when they don't necessarily need to.

The fix is to switch the brackets:

if (busyThreads >= threadCount && (threadCount < MAX_THREADS || (job != null &&
job.getPriority() == Job.INTERACTIVE))) {

Title: Plugins with nested plugin.xml don't get installed properly.
description:
When plugins are installed, plugin.xml is first renamed to 
plugin<somerandomnumber>.xml and at the end of the installation it gets 
renamed to plugin.xml. This is a "security" mechanism to deal with partial 
plugin installs.
org.eclipse.pde.build is contains another plugin.xml file inside the templates 
folder, and its path is being tracked as needing a rename.
The main manifest plugin.xml does not get renamed at the end of the install, 
it stays with the mangled name.
